record.description: Drs. Norman Hilberry (left) and Leo Szilard (right) discuss atomic energy research. The scientists worked with the late Enrico Fermi in achieving the first controlled nuclear chain reaction at the University of Chicago's Stagg Field on December 2, 1942,. The occasion was a ceremony, August 15, 1957, preceding the demolition of the athletic field's West Stands.
